lago-atitlan.title: Lake Atitl√°n
lago-atitlan.summary: A paradise surrounded by volcanoes in Guatemala
lago-atitlan.fullDescription: Lake Atitl√°n is one of the most impressive destinations in Central America, surrounded by volcanoes and Mayan villages full of color and tradition.
highlights: Indigenous Mayan villages full of culture

coban.title: Cob√°n
coban.summary: Exuberant nature and living culture in Alta Verapaz
coban.fullDescription: Delve into the green heart of Guatemala, where the mist kisses the mountains and the crystal clear waters of Semuc Champey invite you to adventure.
highlights: Semuc Champey and its turquoise pools

antigua-guatemala.title: Antigua Guatemala
antigua-guatemala.fullDescription: Walk the streets of one of the most beautiful colonial cities in the world, surrounded by volcanoes and full of history in every corner.
highlights: Santa Catalina Arch and cobblestone streets

san-marcos.title: San Marcos La Laguna
san-marcos.fullDescription: The spiritual center of the lake.

panajachel.title: Panajachel
panajachel.summary: The gateway to Lake Atitl√°n. Affectionately known as "Pana", it is the main access point to Lake Atitl√°n.
panajachel.fullDescription: Panajachel, affectionately known as "Pana", is the primary entry point to Lake Atitl√°n. It offers a perfect blend of modern amenities and local charm, with its famous Santander Street filled with shops, restaurants, and nightlife. It's the ideal place to start your lake adventure, with easy access to all other villages and a wide range of tourist services.
highlights: Santander Street with shops and restaurants

santa-cruz.title: Santa Cruz La Laguna
santa-cruz.summary: Quiet village with the best views and high-altitude diving
santa-cruz.fullDescription: Santa Cruz La Laguna is a picturesque and tranquil village, accessible only by boat. It is famous for having some of the best views of the lake and volcanoes, as well as being home to only professional diving school in Atitl√°n. It is the perfect place to relax, swim, and enjoy nature without the crowds.

tour-sm-001.title: Yoga and Meditation Retreat
tour-sm-001.summary: A transformative mind-body connection experience in a unique natural setting.
tour-sm-001.description: Immerse yourself in the practice of yoga and meditation in one of the most energetic places on Lake Atitl√°n. This retreat includes sunrise yoga sessions, guided meditations, self-knowledge workshops and time for personal reflection.

pana-market-tour.title: Local Market and Santander Street Tour
pana-market-tour.summary: Explore the bustling local market and the famous Santander Street in Panajachel.
pana-market-tour.description: Immerse yourself in local life with this tour that will take you through the authentic market of Panajachel, where you can find everything from exotic fruits to traditional crafts. Then, walk down the iconic Santander Street, full of shops, galleries, and restaurants with a view of the lake.

pana-kayak-sunset.title: Sunset Kayak on the Lake
pana-kayak-sunset.summary: A unique experience kayaking on the waters of Lake Atitl√°n at sunset.
pana-kayak-sunset.description: Enjoy the breathtaking views of the volcanoes as you kayak on the calm waters of the lake. This experience includes a stop at a private beach to enjoy a snack and drinks as the sun sets behind the volcanoes.

pana-culinary-tour.summary: Discover the authentic flavors of Guatemalan cuisine on a gastronomic tour.
pana-culinary-tour.description: This tour will take you to taste the most representative dishes of Guatemalan gastronomy in the local restaurants and stalls of Panajachel. From the typical chuchitos and tamales to traditional desserts, accompanied by local drinks such as atol de elote and Guatemalan coffee.

amanecer-indian-nose-rostro-maya.summary: A short pre-dawn hike to watch the sun rise over Lake Atitl√°n.
amanecer-indian-nose-rostro-maya.description: Climb the iconic Indian Nose viewpoint for a memorable sunrise over Lake Atitl√°n and the volcanoes of San Pedro, Tolim√°n, and Atitl√°n. The tour includes early pickup, a local guide, park access, and a hot drink at the summit.
